TopicTitle: Probably an old one... an amazing view on Milky Way from the surface of Mars

Articles.Content: I've seen these before, but I can't help but feel awed every time I look at them. So beautiful.
Get some kind of life on mars next.
I have never been more disappointed lol. I thought we got some new pics from [MOM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mars_Orbiter_Mission)

Very old joke. Used since the 90's.

Rep for you because good joke.

I've seen the "water on Mars" before, but not the "Milky Way" one.

edit: 

> 
> I have never been more disappointed lol. I thought we got some new pics from [MOM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mars_Orbiter_Mission)

MOM is only an orbiter, it didn't land on the surface

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-09T15:04:50Z" title="04/09/2015 03:04  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 9, 2015</time> by Pipcard**

> 
> I have never been more disappointed lol. I thought we got some new pics from [MOM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mars_Orbiter_Mission)

Well, now...

Here, don't get too disappointed:

![fbFCJ.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/fbFCJ.jpg)

> 
> Well, now...
> Here, don't get too disappointed:
> 
> [http://i.imgur.com/fbFCJ.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/fbFCJ.jpg)

I don't think that's Mars. Not only I couldn't find the source except some sites in Cyrillic alphabet, but also NASA would brag with this nice photo.

This is Earth and it might not even be visible light.
